page.title: 02Changing times 1945-1985 (1)
page.content: In 1959,the Spitals Cross Estate was open fields and owned by the council. Where the entrance to the estate is now,there was a Goodwins brick yard. The population in Edenbridge was two and a half thousand and Spitals Cross school was built in the 1960's. Marlpit Hill had a small shop,a bakers, butchers and a regular milkman.the postal service was not very good, as the postman didn't bother to deliver the letters quickly as there were so few. Edenbridge was a very small town, largely run by business companies. Not many people had televisions and there were no youth clubs at all. People wanted the entertainment but didn't want to organise it! Very few people had cars, so they either walked, used public transport or cycled. Buses full of people ran to Sevenoaks and Oxted.
